resources.string: Tailor your workouts to what's good for you
An exercise where you lay on the floor using your forearms for support and attempting to keep your back straight, working out mainly the core muscles.
A plank where you use your hands for support, working out mainly the core muscles and pecs.
A plank where you support yourself with one arm leaning to the side, working out mainly the deltoid muscle.
An exercise where you lay face up on the floor with your knees bent, and then bring your chest up to your knees while keeping your knees on the floor, working out mainly the abdominal muscles.
Similar to crunches but you bring your chin up to your knees, working out mainly the abdominals muscles.
An exercise where you lay face down on the floor and slowly raise your arms and legs while keeping your chest on the floor, working out mainly glutes and hamstrings.

An exercise where you start in sit up position and then hold your arms straight out in front of you twist your core so that your arms move to the side of your knees and repeat, working out mainly the core muscles.
An exercise where you lay on your pack and raise your legs into the air and simulate a pedaling motion, working out mainly the quads and calves.
A workout where you lay face down on a raised platform and move your legs up in down in a kicking motion, working out the gluteus muscles.
Using a chair or something similar place your hands palms down facing the chair and slowly lower yourself using your arms and then slowly raise yourself back up, working out mainly the triceps.
A combo move where you start with a pushup and then transition into a jumping jack and then back to a push up, working out mainly the quads, pecs, hamstrings, triceps.

An exercise where you take a step forward and then lower yourself bringing your knees to a 90 degree angle. Your back leg should also be at a 90 degree angle to the floor, working out mainly the glutes and core.
An exercise where you jump and spread your arms and legs out and then jump again and bring them back in, working out mainly the glutes and dorsai.
A squat where you link your fingers together behind your head and do a squat, working out mainly the glutes.
A squat where you put your hands together in front of your chest and spread your legs and squat down to your ankles, working out mainly the glutes.
A squat where you hold your arms parallel to the floor and 1 leg parallel to the floor and squat on the 1 leg that is still on the floor, working out mainly the glutes.
A squat where you spread your legs apart and squat as far down as you can go.
A squat where you do the regular squat but on the way up go fast and extend your arms to the sky and jump as high as you can, working out mainly the glutes.
Brace your back against a wall and bend your legs to a 90 degree angle and hold for as long as possible, working out mainly the quadriceps.
Step up one leg at a time to a slightly raised platform such as 2 text books and then step down one leg at a time, working out mainly the quads and calves.
Extend your arms and swing them in a circular motion, working out mainly the shoulder muscles.
Similar to a jumping jack but you hold your arms straight out in front of you and swing them in and out in a clapping motion, working out the shoulder muscles.
Similar to the jumping jack but while doing it you cross your legs in an X fashion, working out mainly the back muscles.
Get on all fours and extend one arm parallel to the ground while extending the opposite leg parallel to the ground, working out the core, back, quads, and triceps.
Similar to the superman but bring your arms folded across your chest and raise your chest up while keeping your legs on the floor.
Similar to a normal pushup but the arms are spread farther apart, working out mainly the outer pecs.
